label: PNPLA6-related spastic paraplegia with or without ataxia
definition: An autosomal recessive, multisystem condition caused by pathogenic variants of the PNPLA6 gene that characterized by peripheral neuropathy, cognitive impairment, lower limb spasticity, muscle weakness, and reduced vibration sense. Additional clinical features may include cerebellar ataxia, hypogonadism, growth hormone deficiency, and hypothyroidism.

label: IKBKG-related immunodeficiency with or without ectodermal dysplasia
definition: Any recessive immunodeficiency (ID), with or without ectodermal dysplasia (EDA), in which the cause of the disease is mutation in the IKBKG gene. ID/EDA-ID patients, always males, are hemizygous for an IKBKG (NEMO) mutation that preserves residual NF-ÎºB activation (hypomorphic mutations) and may also present with osteopetrosis and lymphoedema (OL-EDA-ID).

label: inherited kidney disorder
definition: A type of genetic disorder manifestations of primary clinical importance in the and that primarily results from alterations in one gene or from an alternation of the genome affecting one or more gene or functional element. Said genetic or genomic alteration may be inherited from one or both parents or may occur de novo.

label: Mendelian encephalopathy
definition: An instance of encephalopathy that is caused by an inherited genomic modification in an individual.

label: diffuse gastric and lobular breast cancer syndrome with or without cleft lip and/or palate
microcephaly with intellectual disability
definition: Microcephaly characterized by both microcephaly and atypical neurodevelopment, without other commonly reported non-brain related phenotypes.

label: lumbar disc disease
definition: A vertebral column disorder caused by degeneration of intervertebral discs of the lumbar spine. One of the most common musculoskeletal disorders, it has strong genetic determinants.

label: infantile-onset epilepsy
definition: Epilepsy starting in the first 12 months of life, including self-limiting and refractory seizures, and epilepsies with and without developmental disorders.

label: X-linked mendelian susceptibility to mycobacterial diseases due to IKBKG deficiency
definition: A susceptibility or predisposition to mycobacterial infectious diseases in which the cause of the disease is a mutation in the IKBKG gene.

label: TUBB2A-related tubulinopathy
definition: A tubulinopathy syndrome often associated with microtubule dysfunction, malformations of the corpus callosum, enlarged ventricles, dysgyria, abnormal basal ganglia, cerebellar vermis hypoplasia/dysplasia, and decreased white matter, due to heterozygous variants in TUBB2A. Individuals may present with variable combinations of malformations of the corpus callosum, enlarged ventricles, dysgyria, abnormal basal ganglia, cerebellar vermis hypoplasia/dysplasia, and decreased white matter. Epilepsy, speech impairment, and motor impairment are also frequent features.

label: protothecosis
definition: A disease caused by infection with achlorophyllic algae of the genus Prototheca, the majority caused by the species P. wickerhamii. Clinical manifestations of reported cases have included cutaneous lesions, olecranon bursitis, or systemic involvement.

label: baclofen withdrawal syndrome
definition: Withdrawal syndrome involving the abrupt discontinuation of baclofen therapy (intrathecal or oral). Baclofen withdrawal syndrome can result in high fever, altered mental status (including agitation, insomnia, confusion, delusions, hallucinations, seizures, visual changes, or psychosis), and potentially profound muscular rigidity that sometimes progresses to fatal rhabdomyolysis.

X-linked severe syndromic thoracic aortic aneurysm and dissection
autoimmune limbic encephalitis
definition: A rare autoimmune encephalitis involving the mesial temporal lobes and clinically characterized by subacute onset (i. e. rapid progression of less than three months) of short-term memory deficits, seizures or psychiatric symptoms, such as behavioral changes, anxiety, depression, and psychosis. Further diagnostic criteria are bilateral abnormalities restricted to the mesial temporal lobes in brain MRI, cerebrospinal fluid pleocytosis and/or epileptic or slow-wave activity involving the temporal lobes in EEG, and reasonable exclusion of alternative causes. Paraneoplastic or non-paraneoplastic antibodies against neuronal antigens may be found in serum and/or cerebrospinal fluid.
